properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 1 at 2:18AM MST until February 4 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...SIGNIFICANT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH
MONDAY FOR EAST CENTRAL THROUGH SOUTH CENTRAL WYOMING...

* WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8
inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph.

* WHERE...Northern Sioux County in the Nebraska Panhandle.
Including Harrison.

* WHEN...From Sunday evening through late Monday night.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT
